Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

Title: “Have viewer mode and hardcore mode in minecraft bedrock”  

Text: “I would like them to add the hardcore or extreme mode to minecraft bedrock so that users of smartphones, Windows 10, and current consoles could enjoy new challenges such as not dying or speculating in viewer mode and thus have the full minecraft experience”

Hello
I agree this should be an ability on modern bedrock edition because it was an ability on Xbox 360 edition which was Bedrock edition. It makes no sense to not add to the game if it once existed.

I agree! The customizable superflat worlds were extremely fun to play on. We could make very fun mini games such as TNT survival (where the entire top layer was TNT followed by a layer of lava with a layer of planks below that. Your goal was to survive the longest while you had barely any resources. You could barely walk on the surface either because it was just lava and explosions).

Oh, and how about diamond survival? Where your challenge was to gather every single resource in the game on a flat world where the top was entirely made from diamond ore.

Maybe since Netherite got added, people will try a harder (and funner!) mini game challenge either called "ancient debris survival" or "netherite survival".

That would be SO fun considering the fact that you need a diamond pickaxe to mine netherite. So, as a result, you will need to spend some time looking for diamonds in blacksmith chests JUST to get yourself underground.

So please! Bring back customize superflat worlds back to Minecraft: Console Edition. Please!? Just for us???

If enough people vote for Customized Superflat Worlds for bedrock edition, maybe we could have this become a feature in either Minecraft 1.19 or Minecraft 1.20.

I know that even though you may not want this feature to be added, deep down inside you, you really miss it and want it to come back. Just think of all the amazing challenges that people could do on a superflat world. You could play on the TNT apocalypse survival challenge where the ground is TNT and you had to try to survive the lava-filled ground after the TNT goes off. Or you could try playing on a diamond superflat where the whole entire world is covered in diamonds. You could also try a Rainbow Superflat (just like a YouTuber named NiftySmith did). Besides, Customized Superflat allowed you to beat the game on Superflat Worlds.

Additionally, you will hopefully be inspired with many, many mini game and adventure map ideas for those marketplace creators out there. As a result, bringing back Customized Superflat Worlds will give everyone benefit(s).

This NEEDS to come back. There were so many unique ways to play survival with custom superflats and Mojang said they would be adding it to bedrock at some point about 6 months after Bedrock Edition launched. Maybe after 1.19 Mojang should focus on more world generation options and LESS on new blocks. Get us up to date with Java THEN have fun with all kinds of new updates.
This 100 percent needs to be back. Bedrock players are missing out.

I started out my Minecraft adventures on the Xbox 360 Version and I used to love the ability to Customize my Superflat World to suit the needs of the project I was build. However, since I've been playing the PS4 Version, I have realised that Superflat World Customization had been taken away or not included and that really limited some of my projects because I can never find a decent flat area in Infinite Worlds even if I try using a specific seed for it and when I use Flat Worlds, I only get about 3 layers of dirt and then Bedrock and that's it. I really wish that you would bring this back to the newer generation console versions of Minecraft cause I feel it was the perfect way for people to design their worlds exactly how they needed them to be.

For your first request, there are 2 commands which already do this:

  • /time query day shows the number of in-game days played (multiply by 20 for number of minutes IRL)
  • /time query gametime shows the number of game ticks (divide by 20 for number of seconds IRL

As for your second request, go to:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360009225992--Java-Parity-Spectator-and-Hardcore-game-modes-to-Bedrock-Edition

Loving the new updates and features so far.  But when are we going to get different colored chests for the various wood types? We have that feature for so many items yet chests are over looked.  Would be a nice aesthetic touch plus it would make sorting chests easier and allow for more natural looking building depending on biome.
It looks really good! But the we do need the off hand slot next to the hotbar so we can see how long the shield is stunned for or when it is reusable. But great job mojang!

I see that there's been development for spectator mode, which is great! Now we just need hardcore mode, which should be easy to implement. Hardcore is such a popular youtube challenge, that many players abandoned Bedrock edition simply because they don't have it.

Goat horns should have a use other than "just for fun", perhaps something to do with wardens and sculk sensors, to spawn raid captains, or as a potion ingredient. I don't care too much about copper horns, but I really hope copper can have more uses in the future, such as copper golems, chains, pipes, bars. What copper really needs is a huge sink that players need a lot of, such as decorative building blocks or redstone components like golems and pipes.

I'm hoping for more good parity changes in the future, such as crossbow fireworks exploding on impact! Also, wandering traders in Bedrock should stop spawning deep below the village bell; it's a messy Y-range spawn and players are having difficulty finding them.

Thank you so much for all the hard work!

How about we add Different colored Crafting Tables or something like maybe add something that's more better than the ones we have today, I'm not trying to push it too far but how about we add a hostile mob called "Doll" where it has 720HP, The hardest mob ever, Uses critical melee attacks when you mock it's movements, And it has a creeper blast attack, Drops "Doll Gem" with a Doll Ore or something like that maybe the texture can be a posessed lion from an abandoned style Egyptian Desert Temple and the Doll has it's own temple with different traps like lava traps and poison arrow traps and obstacle courses and chests filled with a bit overpowered loot in it for a good start in the game.

My second comment: The Doll Temple could have a Lava Trap where if you can't find anything on the ground you walk through the small tunnel and all of a sudden Tripwire Hooks and Strings spawn and you fall into lava and there could be another trap like A 3x3 Puzzle similar to the Jungle Temple's 3x1 Puzzle, But bigger. And then the 3x3 puzzle will trick you into turning on the wrong Lever and then the Mossy Cobble or Normal Cobble will disappear and you'll fall into a lava pool. There could also be a Hedge Maze too that's 100x100 and there could be even some prisoners which would be Wandering Traders with a prisoner texture walking around the maze trying to find the way out, Mojang could also add hard parkour obstacle courses and Lava Parkour Courses in the Doll Temple too. Sounds like a good idea everyone, Right?

Can you please add full customization for mobile touch controls? We need to be able to change the position, size, and opacity of each button. It's essential for mobile gaming, some players prefer to use 4 fingers (thumbs + index on the upper corners), and devices/hands vary in size. Adding additional buttons for quick-switching hotbar weapons is also welcome (such as a button that instantly makes me equip my slot 2 weapon). Lastly, add action buttons for touch mode as well; holding touch to fire crossbows is too slow!

Warden sonic boom should bypass protection enchantment, but not projectile protection. Nobody uses it, so it'd be great if it can have a use VS wardens.

Wither fight is still problematic on most devices due to lag as it scatters hundreds of item entities. If possible, we need to reduce item entity lag, which also helps redstone/allay farms. Option to render items as simple 2D sprites?

Also, please add fireflies in the future. If you want players to join in on the development, please listen to them. Players love the 2 pixel particle mob, it's great for ambience & bottled fireflies make excellent lights in builds. Just prevent frogs from eating them if that's too much of a concern.

Please stop adding humanoid/undead hostile mobs, we need more animal-like hostile mobs. Hostile fantasy fishes, @lligat0rs, wyverns, arthropods... please stop being PETA, trying to teach kids that fireflies are poisonous to frogs (but not magma?) and just make a fun fantasy game.

The mangrove swamp biome is way too rare and too small, they should be increased. Allay spawn chance can also be increased, they are very difficult to find. Deep dark ancient cities are still spawning a lot of mobs and it might cause lag if they kept activating sculk and wardens below your base. The no-spawn area needs to be larger. I hope these can be fixed before 1.19 releases!

Spectator is great and I hope hardcore mode will come to bedrock too. Also, wandering traders are still spawning very deep below village bells, this issue makes it extremely difficult for players to find wandering traders, and can cause lag as persistent trader llamas will often generate.

It seems like there's more block placement parity from java to bedrock on the last beta, which is welcome. There's a lot of building tutorials out there, such as placing lanterns on trapdoors and below campfires, placing flower pots below chains and leaves, placing coral fans on waterlogged blocks (and not die), and none of these worked on bedrock edition.

I'm hoping for more parity changes, such as fireworks crossbows exploding on impact like in java. This cool weapon is unfortunately useless in bedrock. Spectral arrows are also very cool drops from piglin barters and I hope we can get them.
muchas gracias

The colors of frogs in different groups are very unreasonable. I feel that the desert should be orange, the grass should be green, and the white snow should be white... I don't know what the official reason for this arrangement is.

Warden and deep dark is truly the best part of this update. Though in the future, I'm really hoping for an actual wild update. Mobs like crickets can add a ton of immersion and ambience to Minecraft, and they can be food for frogs, axolotls, fish. Ambient sound effects like rustling leaves and cave drips are also great. Now THAT's a wild update!

I feel like the deep dark still needs more sculk material, especially shriekers. There's too much boring gray. It's too easy to clear an ancient city without any warden spawning. Wardens should spawn easier; three sculk shrieker activation should be enough to summon the warden!

Also, there should be a way to disable potion particle effects for the player. It's difficult to take screenshots of your base if you have a beacon, because the particle effects obstruct your view.

I am satisfied with the beta release, however, there is an important change that would be important to note so it can be fixed. With the placement of signs, I have noticed that the signs no longer have the same interface. When we type, we must type in one line and hope that it fits in the sign. I feel like that would be confusing especially for users who are used to typing and pressing enter to go to the next line, and also so they can see the sign while they are typing. I wanted to make a note of this issue, other than that this beta has me really excited and I am super satisfied with the product. :)
